Sentencas: In state-of-the-art, anode-supported, solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) the fuel electrode is made of two different porous Ni/stabilized zirconia layers, both with specified phase compositions and microstructural characteristics.
Titulo: Advanced impedance model for double-layered solid oxide fuel cell cermet anodes

Sentencas: It is generally assumed that electro-oxidation of fuel takes place in the thinner anode functional layer (AFL) adjacent to the electrolyte, while gas diffusion takes place in the thicker anode substrate (AS).
Titulo: Advanced impedance model for double-layered solid oxide fuel cell cermet anodes

Sentencas: This assumption is not always applicable and established models fail.
Titulo: Advanced impedance model for double-layered solid oxide fuel cell cermet anodes

Sentencas: This paper introduces a generally valid equivalent circuit model by means of a three-channel transmission line model (3CTLM) that considers electro-oxidation, ionic conduction and gas diffusion.
Titulo: Advanced impedance model for double-layered solid oxide fuel cell cermet anodes

Sentencas: It is parameterized by (i) impedance measurements on model-electrodes, (ii) conductivity measurements, (iii) FIB/SEM-tomography and (iv) gas theory.
Titulo: Advanced impedance model for double-layered solid oxide fuel cell cermet anodes

Sentencas: The complex impedance curve is derived by a newly developed numerical routine that uses calculation steps from network analysis.
Titulo: Advanced impedance model for double-layered solid oxide fuel cell cermet anodes

Sentencas: A model validation is performed by comparing measured and simulated impedance spectra of anode-supported SOFCs varying in AFL thickness from 3 to 22 mu m.
Titulo: Advanced impedance model for double-layered solid oxide fuel cell cermet anodes

Sentencas: The 3CTLM is capable of predicting the impedance of any Ni/stabilized zirconia anode design.
Titulo: Advanced impedance model for double-layered solid oxide fuel cell cermet anodes

Sentencas: A model-based optimization is demonstrated, selecting different ionic conducting phases in AFL and AS for combinations of Ni/10Sc1CeSZ, Ni/8YSZ and Ni/3YSZ, across a temperature range of 600-900 degrees C.
Titulo: Advanced impedance model for double-layered solid oxide fuel cell cermet anodes
